column5: Hey everyone..... this is a non fishing question, but I dont know where I can ask and get feed back like this site.  I have an Iphone 4S.... only had it a few weeks, its starting to grow on me. I still miss my black berry keyboard though.  Any how..... what are some MUST HAVE apps.... with the oodles and oodles of them, Its pretty tough to find some good USEFUL ones.  can you suggest any you cant live with out, or that actually are helpful with everyday life ?   Thanks
navionics the weather network fish calender--bite window app facebook mapquest canadian tire my convert--converts everything google earth yellow pages photobucket
Search iphone and you'll find a bunch of recent threads about apps

There's one called shazam that listens to any song and tells you the name and artist.  Kinda cool.  Other then that, ya, TSN, Weather Network, Facebook, converter.  I don't play games on my phone so don't know any good games.

The Score is by far the most superior sports app.  Weathernetwork Canadian Tire Home Depot The Hockey News Isnowmobile (OFSC trail guide and maps with up to date trail conditions) Solar Walk Star Walk   It is endless really
Globe and Mail New York Times CBC Instagram Photoshop Express Ihandy Level Plumb Bob Skype Guitar Tuner (for my son) Evernote Angle App Atmospherique Link to OFC!

All the Papers  Boston Globe Washington Post Detroit Free Press LA Times ETC ETC.  A free level ProBoards (great for Spoonpullers) tons of kids games if you have an iPad MacLeans Slate magazine TED mobile CBC CBC radio Wimp.com The Onion BBC Ebay Kijiji Auto Trader Tunein Radio Pro  (incredible, you can listen to any radio station in the world) Jango Radio
There's a free Tiger Woods game that I like
You should try soundhound instead of shazam. It is faster and gives you the lyrics in a karaoke style. Very cool app.
Is that the one where you try to escape in a SUV while your old lady is swinging a golf club at you?

Yuuuup I agree.. I would also add Kijiji, future shop and best buy to the list if you like buying stuff..  ifish Ontario is pretty good for finding lakes ( only lakes) too. If you don't have a GPS, then add Motion-X and Motion-X drive as well as a topo map app simply called "Canada"..  The built in GPS works pretty good.  Beware that when running GPS that the battery depletes stupid fast so you have to have it plugged in or not leave the app on when you don't need it..

Love my iphone.  Thanx for the apps guys.  One I really like is maps.  I recently re located to Sudbury, so not familiar with the city.  Get a map of Sudbury up, then type in beer store click "search" it will show u the beer store locations, click "route" it will show u how to get there from your present location.  Oh yah, it will show u other stores as well CTC, Future Shop, Bass Pro.  HA HA
whats app is a must have for talking to blackberry users and iphone users. saves you usage!
Fishing Apps  More fishing apps  Boating Apps
